title: FRQ Score
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

General Considerations

The response must correctly articulate a defensible claim or thesis that responds to the prompt and establishes a line of reasoning.

For Task A, the response must make a defensible claim that responds to the prompt and establishes a line of reasoning about whether the filibuster is beneficial or detrimental to policy making in the United States Congress.

NOTE: The claim or thesis must consist of one or more sentences that may be located anywhere in the response. A claim or thesis that meets the criteria can be awarded the point whether or not the rest of the response successfully supports that line of reasoning.

For Task B1, the response provides one piece of evidence that is accurately linked to the topic of the prompt.

For Task B2, the response provides one piece of specific and relevant evidence to support the claim or thesis.

NOTE: This evidence can come from one of the foundational documents listed in the prompt, any other foundational document, or from knowledge of course concepts.

For Task B3, the response provides two pieces of specific and relevant evidence to support the claim or thesis.

NOTE: To earn 3 points, the response MUST use one of the foundational documents.

For Task C, the response correctly explains why the evidence supports the claim or thesis.

NOTE: To earn this point, the response must have a defensible claim or thesis (earned the point for Task A) AND support that argument with at least one piece of specific and relevant evidence (earned at least 2 points in Task B. The explanation of the relationship between one piece of evidence and the claim or thesis is sufficient to earn this point.

For Task D, the response responds to an opposing or alternate perspective using refutation, concession, or rebuttal.

NOTE: Must describe an alternate perspective AND refute, concede, or rebut the perspective. Responses that demonstrate an incorrect understanding of the alternate perspective do not earn this point.

To earn points for Tasks B2, B3, C, and D, the response must first earn a point for Task A articulating a defensible claim or thesis.
descriptions: The response accomplishes none of the tasks set by the prompt.

The response accomplishes Task A and Task B1 or Task A and Task D.

For a student to earn a point for Task D, they must first earn the Task A point.

The response accomplishes Task A, Task B1, and Task D or Task A and Task B2.

For a student to earn a point for Tasks B2 or D, they must first earn the Task A point.

The response accomplishes Task A and Task B3 or Task A, Task B2, and Task C or Task A, Task B2, and Task D. For a student to earn a point for Tasks B2, B3, C, or D, they must first earn the Task A point.

The response accomplishes Task A, Task B3, and Task C or Task A, Task B3, and Task D or Task A, Task B2, Task C, and Task D. For a student to earn a point for Tasks B2, B3, C, or D, they must first earn the Task A point.
The response accomplishes Task A, Task B3, Task C and Task D. For a student to earn a point for Tasks B3, C, or D, they must first earn the Task A point.
